title: Brittney Griner’s Prison Term Is Upheld by Russian Court
description: The W.N.B.A. athlete is facing nine years in a Russian prison on a drug charge. A prisoner swap may be her only path home.

title: Biden Says Russian Use of a Nuclear Weapon Would Be a ‘Serious Mistake’
description: President Biden’s remarks reflect the urgent concern in Washington and among Western allies that Russia may be searching for a pretext to unleash a battlefield nuclear weapon.

title: A Secret, Failed Oil Deal: How the U.S.-Saudi Relationship Ruptured
description: Ahead of President Biden’s trip to Saudi Arabia this summer, his administration thought it had secured pledges of increases in oil production throughout the year. The opposite happened.

title: Sunak Faces Political Test of His Career: Unify Party, Fix the Economy
description: The Conservative Party is fractured and Britain’s public finances are battered. That will test the political skills of a leader who has been involved in national politics for only seven years.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Tensions Rise in the West Bank
description: Plus Myanmar’s junta kills dozens and Brittney Griner faces nine years in a Russian penal colony.

title: Liberal House Democrats Retract Call on Biden to Seek Cease-Fire in Ukraine
description: One day after issuing a letter urging the administration to seek direct diplomatic talks with Russia aimed at forging a cease-fire, progressives withdrew that call, reflecting deepening divisions over the conflict.

title: In Sunak’s Top Cabinet Ministers, an Emphasis on Continuity
description: The new prime minister named people with high-level experience, several of them to posts they have held before, sending a message of stability after a period of upheaval.

title: Some Britons fear Sunak is too rich to understand working-class suffering.
description: A British worker earning the median wage would have to have been working since the Stone Age to amass the new prime minister’s fortune, one group estimated.

title: Germany’s Allies Challenge Its Stances on Ukraine and Energy
description: The government has dismissed criticism of its refusal to provide modern tanks to Ukraine and its massive energy subsidy for its own citizens. But its friends are bridling.

title: What Are ‘Dirty Bombs’ and Why Is Russia Talking About Them?
description: The idea of radiological dispersal devices is not new, and Russia’s claim that Ukraine would build and use one has been met with scorn from the West.

title: Rishi Sunak Is a Brexit Supporter. Here’s What He’ll Have to Navigate.
description: While he was among the first to come out in favor of Britain’s exit from the European Union, he hasn’t shared the Conservative Party’s hard-line approach.

title: Rishi Sunak Is the Youngest UK Prime Minister of Modern Times
description: Mr. Sunak is 42 and started out in Parliament in 2015.

title: Rishi Sunak Keeps Jeremy Hunt as UK Chancellor
description: Mr. Hunt became Britain’s top finance official after his predecessor’s plan for tax cuts and borrowing caused financial turmoil.

title: Deadly Israeli Raid Targets New Palestinian Militia
description: At least six Palestinians were killed in a night of violence in the West Bank, raising tensions further ahead of elections in Israel next week.

title: Emperor Penguins Are Protected Under the Endangered Species Act
description: Under the new listing, federal agencies are required to reduce threats to emperor penguins, which are vulnerable to warming temperatures and melting sea ice caused by climate change.

title: Rishi Sunak’s First Speech as UK Prime Minister: Full Transcript
description: In his first address as Britain’s prime minister, Mr. Sunak promised “integrity, professionalism and accountability.”

title: Trumpism Beyond Trump
description: Which version of the Republican Party will win out?

title: Airstrike Kills at Least 80 During Outdoor Concert in Myanmar
description: The bombing was the deadliest aerial attack mounted by the military regime since it seized power in a coup last year.

title: Old U.K. Ritual Now Has 2 New Participants: King Charles and Rishi Sunak
description: Queen Elizabeth II welcomed 15 British prime ministers during her seven-decade reign. Rishi Sunak will be the first to start his time as leader under King Charles III.

title: U.K. Live Updates: Truss Holds Last Cabinet Meeting; Sunak Prepares to Take Over as Prime Minister
description: The new Conservative Party leader will meet with King Charles III and deliver a speech outside No. 10 Downing Street. He will be Britain’s third prime minister in less than four months.

title: Brittney Griner’s Appeal Will Be Heard in Russian Court
description: The American basketball star was sentenced to nine years in prison, and her case has been dragged into the political maelstrom between Moscow and Washington.

title: House Progressives Urge Biden to Engage in Direct Talks With Russia
description: Thirty Democrats called on the Biden administration to “seek a realistic framework for a cease-fire” that is acceptable to Ukraine.

title: Three Inquiries, but No Answers to Who Blew Holes in Nord Stream Pipelines
description: Denmark, Germany and Sweden are all investigating the ruptured pipeline sites, but they remain tight-lipped over who might have caused the damage and why.

title: Three Inquiries, but No Answers to Who Blew Holes in Nord Stream Pipelines
description: Denmark, Germany and Sweden are all investigating the ruptured pipeline sites, but they remain tight-lipped over who might have caused the damage and why.

title: Why People Are Flocking to a Symbol of Taiwan’s Authoritarian Past
description: At a museum dedicated to Taiwan’s not-so-distant authoritarian past, Taiwanese see China’s present, and a dark vision of one possible future under autocratic rule.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Britain’s next leader.

title: 3 Palestinians Killed in Shootout With Israeli Forces, Palestinians Say
description: Three Palestinians were killed during a firefight with Israeli security forces who had entered Nablus, a flash point city in the occupied West Bank, Palestinian officials said.

title: Dietrich Mateschitz, Creator of the Red Bull Empire, Dies at 78
description: The Austrian salesman turned a Thai energy drink into a marketing juggernaut that owned sports teams, media outlets and a winning Formula 1 crew.
